label: Archival Service
definition: A gRPC API layer that exposes access to this store, enabling point lookups of historical data, ex., LedgerService.

label: Archival Store
definition: A long-term storage system that holds checkpoint-indexed Sui data, i.e., Bigtable.

label: Causal history
definition: The relationship between an object in Sui and its direct predecessors and successors. This history is essential to the causal order Sui uses to process transactions.

label: Causal order
definition: A representation of the relationship between transactions and the objects they produce, laid out as dependencies. Validators cannot execute a transaction dependent on objects created by a prior transaction that has not finished. Rather than total order, Sui uses causal order (a partial order).

label: Certificate
definition: The mechanism proving a transaction was approved or certified. Validators vote on transactions, and aggregators collect a Byzantine-resistant majority of these votes into a certificate and broadcast it to all Sui validators, thereby ensuring finality.

label: Closed-Loop Token
definition: A token that can be used only for a specific service, by an authorized account, or a token that certain accounts can be blocked from using.

label: DeepBook
definition: A decentralized central limit order book (CLOB) built on Sui. The Sui documentation refers to the DeepBook standard as "DeepBookV3" to avoid confusion with the recently deprecated version of DeepBook (DeepBookV2).

label: Devnet
definition: A development network where data is wiped regularly as part of scheduled software updates.

label: Epoch
definition: Operation of the Sui network is temporally partitioned into non-overlapping, fixed-duration epochs. During a particular epoch, the set of validators participating in the network is fixed.

label: Equivocation
definition: The malicious action of dishonest actors giving conflicting information for the same message, such as inconsistent or duplicate voting.

label: Eventual consistency
definition: The consensus model employed by Sui; if one honest validator certifies the transaction, all of the other honest validators will too eventually.

label: Finality
definition: The assurance a transaction will not be revoked. This stage is considered closure for an exchange or other blockchain transaction.

label: Gas
definition: The computational effort required for executing operations on the Sui network. In Sui, gas is paid with the network's native currency SUI. The cost of executing a transaction in SUI units is referred to as the transaction fee.

label: Genesis
definition: The initial act of creating accounts and gas objects for a Sui network. Sui provides a genesis command that allows users to create and inspect the genesis object setting up the network for operation.

label: Localnet
definition: A locally created development network running on your local machine.

label: Kiosk
definition: A decentralized system for commerce applications on Sui. The Sui Kiosk standard consists of Kiosk objects: shared objects owned by individual parties that store assets that can be sold or traded.

label: Mainnet
definition: The Sui production network.

label: Multi-writer objects
definition: Objects that are owned by more than one address. Transactions affecting multi-writer objects require consensus in Sui. This contrasts with transactions affecting only single-writer objects, which require only a confirmation of the owner's address contents.

label: Mysticeti
definition: The consensus protocol used on Sui. Mysticeti is a high-throughput, Directed Acyclic Graph (DAG)-based Byzantine consensus protocol.

label: Object
definition: The basic unit of storage in Sui. Sui objects have one of the following primary states: Immutable (cannot be modified) or Mutable (can be modified). Mutable objects are further divided into Owned (modified only by its owner) or Shared (modified by anyone).

label: Operation Cap
definition: Allows a validator to authorize another account to perform certain actions on its behalf.

label: Proof-of-stake
definition: A blockchain consensus mechanism where the voting weight of each validator is proportional to a bonded amount of the network's native currency (called their stake in the network).

label: Single-writer objects
definition: Objects owned by one address. In Sui, transactions affecting only single-writer objects owned by the same address may proceed with only a verification of the sender's address, greatly speeding transaction times.

label: Smart contract
definition: An agreement based upon the protocol for conducting transactions in a blockchain. In Sui, smart contracts are written in the Move programming language.

label: Sui
definition: The Sui blockchain and the Sui open source project as a whole.

label: SUI
definition: The native token to the Sui network.

label: Sui Keystore
definition: A secure storage system for managing your Sui cryptographic key pairs.

label: Sui Keytool
definition: A CLI tool that provides commands for managing and generating addresses, and interacting with private keys, signatures, or zkLogin.

label: SuiLink
definition: A Mysten Labs product that connects wallets across chains to support use cases such as cross chain wallet verification, asset ownership verification, and asset distributions across chains.

label: Sui Object Display
definition: A template engine that enables on-chain management of off-chain representation (display) for a type.

label: Soulbound
definition: An asset that is bound to an account and cannot be transferred.

label: Testnet
definition: A development network. Data deployed to Testnet persists through the regular update process, but might be wiped when necessary. Testnet data wipes are announced ahead of time.

label: Total order
definition: The ordered presentation of the history of all transactions processed by a traditional blockchain up to a given time. This is maintained by many blockchain systems, as the only way to process transactions. In contrast, Sui uses a causal (partial) order wherever possible and safe.

label: Transaction
definition: A change to the blockchain. This may be a simple transaction affecting only single-writer, single-address objects, such as minting an NFT or transferring an NFT or another token. More complex transactions affecting objects that are shared or owned by multiple addresses go through consensus.

label: Transfer
definition: Switching the owner address of a token to a new one via command in Sui.

label: Validator
definition: In Sui, validators do not continuously participate in the consensus protocol but are called into action only when receiving a transaction or certificate.

label: Wallet Standard
definition: A cross-chain standard that defines how dApps can automatically discover and interact with wallets.
